message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();
String mainWinID = itererator.next();
String newAdwinID = itererator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(3000);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(2000);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: The code uses the Iterator.next method to get the next window handle from the windowId set. It then switches to the new window, performs some actions, and closes it. Finally, it switches back to the main window and closes it as well.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();
String mainWinID = itererator.next();
String newAdwinID = itererator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(3000);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(2000);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, the getWindowHandles() method returns a set of window handles. You can use an iterator to iterate through the set and switch to the desired window using the next() method of the iterator. After performing the necessary actions in the new window, you can switch back to the main window using the switchTo().window() method and close the windows using the close() method.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();
String mainWinID = itererator.next();
String newAdwinID = itererator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(3000);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(2000);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next method to iterate through the window handles and switch to the desired window. In this code, we first get the window handles using Driver.getWindowHandles(). Then, we create an iterator for the set of window handles and use the next method to get the IDs of the main window and the new window. We switch to the new window using Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID), perform some actions, and then close the new window using Driver.close(). Finally, we switch back to the main window using Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID) and close it as well.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();
String mainWinID = itererator.next();
String newAdwinID = itererator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(3000);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(2000);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next method to switch between windows in Selenium WebDriver. After getting the window handles using Driver.getWindowHandles(), you can iterate through the window IDs using the Iterator and switch to the desired window using Driver.switchTo().window(). Then you can perform any actions on that window and close it using Driver.close().

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> iterator = Driver.getWindowHandles().iterator();
String mainWinID = iterator.next();
String newAdwinID = iterator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next method to switch between the main window and the pop-up window. First, get the window handles using Driver.getWindowHandles(), then create an iterator from the set of window handles. Use the iterator.next() method to switch to the pop-up window, perform any actions needed, and then switch back to the main window using the iterator.next() method again. Finally, close both windows using the Driver.close() method.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<String> iterator = Driver.getWindowHandles().iterator();
String mainWinID = iterator.next();
String newAdwinID = iterator.next();
Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(3000);
Driver.close();
Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);
System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
Thread.sleep(2000);
Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next method to switch between windows. First, get the window handles using Driver.getWindowHandles(), then create an iterator and use it to switch to the new window. After performing actions on the new window, switch back to the main window using Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID). Finally, close both windows using Driver.close().

It then prints the title of the new window, waits for 3 seconds, closes the new window, switches back to the main window, prints its title, waits for 2 seconds, and finally closes the main window.
